intro: Mystacidium zeylanicum, commonly known as the Indian starfruit or carambola, is a tropical plant belonging to the family Oxalidaceae. It is native to Southeast Asia and is characterized by its distinctive five-pointed star-shaped fruit. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and have a serrated margin, while its flowers are small and white with five petals. The fruit develops from a single flower and is edible, with a tangy, acidic flavor when ripe.
